intro: Lankesteriana duplooyi, commonly known as the Ecuadorian flame orchid, is a striking epiphytic orchid native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It features vibrant red and orange flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring, making it a notable ornamental plant. The plant has long, arching stems with fleshy, dark green leaves that help it thrive in humid, shaded environments. It requires high humidity and indirect light to flourish, often growing on trees or rocks in its natural habitat. Its unique coloration and rarity make it a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
